name: Hotel Viennart am Museumsquartier

reviews.text: I just love this hotel, we stayed 7 years ago and it has been totally refurbished which has made it even better. The foyer and breakfast room are lovely and so was our room. Fourth floor, comfortable and spacious and lovely. Everything about this hotel is relay great, the buffet breakfast has really wide choice to start the day...including a glass of fizz ! The staff are friendly, smiling and helpful which is unusual in city centre hotels . As for the location it's perfect, smack bang on the Museum Quarter, Spittelberg and the Kuntshistorisches Museuem plus the U bahn and the trams . Ten out of ten,well done!
reviews.title: Great hotel brilliantly located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel in a great location, very central near U bahn station Volkstheater and the trams of the Ringstrasse. We stayed here seven years ago and the hotel has been refurbished since then making it even better. Our room was terrific , on the top floor, large and comfortable. the staff are really friendly and helpful too. Breakfast was excellent, everything that you could wish for and a glass of fizz too!! Spittelberg is a great location for an evening wander with plenty of bars and a wide range of restaurants plus the Museum Quarter is across the road. We have had a great time in Vienna and the hotel made it so much better. Would recommend to anyone and would definitely love to stay again.
reviews.title: Four stars, and most rooms don't have air conditioning?

reviews.text: My wife and I went to Vienna at the end of Sept. Just when it started getting cool. The hotel was conveniently located, and got a 4 star rating, which is why we picked it. We arrived in the afternoon, and the hotel staff were welcoming. The stairs that you have to carry your suitcases up at the entrance did not make for an inviting first impression.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay in heart of Museum Quarter

reviews.text: The weather was cool, it was in the 40 degrees F at night, and 60 degrees F during the day. It made for some very cold nights in the room.. Apparently, the old water boiler heat system was not very efficient, and the room was very cold. The hotel staff were quick to provide extra blankets and try to fix the heat, but it still did not work very well. The free coffee/juice was nice, along with free wi-fi in the rooms was a plus. It would have been nice to be allowed to enjoy the free cappuccino up in the room, which would have helped to keep us warm.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, very good value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's in the artsy-fartsy museum quarter. I mean right across the street from it. That's great and so is the service and the breakfast and the bedding, but that's all. I have a couple of big problems and a couple of small problems. BP1: to lock the door it takes a key. So when leaving the room one needs to lock the door, ok, but if your spouse is in the room, she's locked in and cannot get out unless the front desk gives you two keys on check-in, and they do not; BP2: breakfast is WAY over priced for anyone (like me) who has coffee and a pastry, and maybe juice (liquids are free, BTW, all day long). So, the doughnut in fact costs 15 Euros. That's too much. And small problems: SP1: the room was not aired out upon our arrival and so it smelled; SP2: it is not air conditioned; SP3: it's noisy on the street below because the artsy-fartsy folks are young, drunk, and clueless.
reviews.title: Quirky 3-star advertising as a 4

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is good - not far from the metro station (2 minutes on foot) and the city centre (20 minutes on foot).
reviews.title: Good place to stay in Vienna

reviews.text: Free WiFi is a benefit but you need to regularly renew the pasword at reception.The staff is very polite and helpful.
reviews.title: Amazing location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is very small (we stayed at standard room), it seemed that the bathroom is of the same size. But we stayed for 1 night only, therefore it was ok. The room was furnished very nicely. Others say, there is no air-conditioning in the building - we have no need as stayed in October.
reviews.title: Great location, stylish new hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was very impressive - it was completely white, very clean, very large but warm. Lots accessories such as shower gel, shampoo, shaver, tothbrashes, etc. were provided which was really unexpected from 4 stars hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, good price, excellent value, but no parking and no air conditioning on the room...close to the museum quarter,lots of shops and the excellence restaurant Glasis Bleisl
reviews.title: Clean, new, great location, but no air conditioning and no parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Espresso and tea free of charge.
reviews.title: Do not trust the photos of their rooms
Hostels can be better than this "4 star hotel"

reviews.text: PROS: 1. Free drink. You can have free drink all the day in the hotel restaurant. It includes coffee, hot chocolate, juice, water and so on. 2. The restaurant and lobby look very nice and fashioned. (But be careful! Your room will look like being in another world.) 3. This hotel is near museums quartier and metro.
reviews.title: good, comfortable, clean, perfect location
great lobby, rooms need improvement
reviews.text: CONS: 1. No air conditioner. My room was an attic. It was hot in the summer. So I have to use clothes hangers to keep the windows open all the night. They will provide you a small portable fan. But it is noisy and not helpful if you travel in the summer. 2. The room is very basic compared to its lobby. I guess they wanted to renovate the hotel. But when they finished the renovation of lobby. They found that they had no budget. So you may feel like the lobby and rooms are totally in different worlds. 3. The breakfast is very expensive: 15 Euro per person. Luckily, its quality is fine. But I still think that it is not worthy.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: Leaving this hotel after a short trip to Vienna - we had a great time! The hotel is in a good location for Mariahilfestrasse; a super shopping street. The room was clean and warm; the beds were comfortable with nice fresh linen and we had a really good night's sleep. The staff are friendly and the lovely girl on reception who found my rucksack (which I'd left on the floor by mistake) kept it safe and handed it back to me when I went to reception in a panic. I would definitely stay here again.
It's also a good location if you are interested in the museum quarter. I recommend Oberlaa for hot chocolate and a slice of chocolate cake - just 10 minutes from the hotel.
reviews.title: Not 4 star but totally adequate

reviews.text: Used the hotel as a base for exploring Vienna. Excellent location, close to the Volkstheater U bahn and the No. 1 & 2 trams around the Ring (don't waste your money on the Ring Tram). Helpful staff at Reception and the room was fine. Hot and cold drinks downstairs was a plus, althought the coffee machine broke on day 2.
reviews.title: Good value and great location

reviews.text: Nice hotel in an excellent location. Close to metro and all old town and museum quarter attractions. Booked online and got a good deal for 65€ a night. Also only 3 metro stops from main train station westbahnhof
reviews.title: Ditto

description: Art, Design & Joy of LivingThe ideal city hotel in ViennaWelcome to Hotel ViennArt. Located in the heart of the romantic Biedermeier quarter "Spittelberg", our house offers ideal conditions for an unforgettable stay in Vienna. Experience the Wiener Ringstraße with its historical buildings, explore the Museum of Natural History and the Museum of Art, and be fascinated by the famous Hofburg. Stroll along Vienna's longest shopping boulevard and relax in a traditional Viennese pub, called "Beisl" - all within walking distance!
